Hi! Welcome to my homepage.

I am Brian Daza. Since Fall 2021 I'm an Economics Ph.D. student at the University of Michigan. 

The topics I fancy the most are in the intersection of trade and (mostly macro) development economics.

My research experience includes being a Research Assistant for MIT, the World Bank's DIME, and the Research Center of Universidad del Pac√≠fico. I also worked as a consultant for the Peruvian Government in the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Transports and Communication.
